Reviews.Content: A lovely stay       Healthy breakfast offerings
Reviews.Author: CarenWashington

Reviews.Content: Clean and a great bargain and location We were pleasantly surprised by this wonderful hotel that is just two blocks from the main train station (Hbf). It has grand marble stairs and everything was very clean. A great hot breakfast was included. There are lots of great restaurants in the area, plus it is only a few blocks to the riverfront foot bridge, the Opera, etc. What a great place to stay if you need to be at the Airport for a flight the next day. We were able to leave the hotel, walk to the train station and be at the airport in just 15 minutes (10 of which was the train ride). There is a free Internet computer in the lobby and the front desk staff spoke flawless English and was very friendly and helpful.
Reviews.Author: Maquoketa Mark

Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with friendly staff. We (parents and two kids) stayed here fora night at the end of the August 2007 Museumsuferfest.It is a clean hotel; suite 512 was a good size for 4 peoplebut it was unclear whether the air conditioning would haveworked had we needed it. Friendly staff. Good buffet breakfast, but no hot items. Fast Internet access on computer in lobby. Hotel is near what appears to be red-light district, but the area also features many eateries and is close to main train station.
Reviews.Author: EugeC

Reviews.Content: Small hotel, very helpful staff, good experience My experience at the Hotel Victoria was very positive. It is very near the Frankfurt main train station with several restrauants and cafes around. The staff are extremely helpful, especially to foreigners who are not familar with local area. The hotel is near a red light area, but it is not in this area only near it. The cost is reasonable and a good value.
Reviews.Author: sleepy01

Reviews.Content: Good place to stay. My stay at the Victoria Hotel in Frankfurt was a pleasant one, The hotel is very basic, clean, central and the staff was friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was also very good. We were 2 people on this trip and booked a triple room which was the same price as a twin room at the time. The room was spacious and the bathroom very clean. The only drawback was the busy street outside the hotel. Nothing earplugs can't fix. Overall a very pleasant stay.
Reviews.Author: marcodejongh

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel The Victoria Hotel am Main is a great hotel. I love the hotel鈥檚 close location to the Main train station. This makes the transition from the airport to the city very simple. The breakfast was wonderful! The staff was very helpful. The rooms were small but very clean and comfortable. There is computer/internet access in the lobby. The only draw back to this hotel was the adult stores in this area of town. I would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: javabeaner

Reviews.Content: Small Rooms but Helpful Staff We stayed 3 nights in this hotel - the room was suprisingly small. We had to climb over the bed and our 2 suitcases to get to the bathroom (also tiny but functional - hair dryer  hot shower) and the door. The beds are comfortable but very low to the floor and our room smelled of stale cigarette smoke even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room. The staff was very helpful and nice - they were very happy to offer suggestions on restaurants, shopping and getting around town. They had a nice complimentary breakfast buffet that may have seemed like an odd combination of foods - seafood salad, salami, smoked salmon, soft boiled eggs and lots of breads... also cereal, yogurt and fruit. Yes, it is in the 'red light' district but it felt very safe at night - and since most of the attractions and shopping are either a few metro stops away or a 20 minute walk away, you're likely not to be spending much time in the area. All in all we good a good nights sleep and a filling breakfast for a decent rate. Be sure to check the rates for different days.Small but good for the money, helpful staff and close to the metro. I give it a 7 out of 10.
Reviews.Author: littlepooh

Reviews.Content: Staff is great help. We just stayed at the Victoria..........both at beginning and ending of our trip. During the first stay of two nights, the hotel was booked except for one room, which we got. It was rather small and tired looking, but clean. Our bicycles had been lost by the airlines and we were needing a place to hang til they arrived. The staff all speak excellent English and were very helpful. They even called the airline for us to see if they could help find our bikes. The hotel is in the red light district, but we never felt threatened. It is a bit noisy...you might want to wear earplugs while sleeping. The breakfast buffett was excellent with a vast selection of meats, cheeses, breads, etc. and the option to order eggs as well. On our second stay we were given a lovely, large corner room. Too bad that was for only one night!
Reviews.Author: bicyclists

Reviews.Content: you get what you paid for I've been to victoria hotel for the 2nd time in 2 years. Great location in the middle of frankfurt , but watch out during night time because it's also quite near the red district of frankfurt.Average hotel in terms of rooms and service . Breakfast is ok , although the buffet is too small , but you still can order eggs , tea , coffee and other from the service...Excellent hotel if you're in a business trip and having to pass one or two nights in frankfurt - but not quite a hotel where you want to spend a family vacation.....in few words : you just get what you paid for : no more , no less....
Reviews.Author: beirut2005

Reviews.Content: Great Rates, Great Location Very happy with the stay. Very good location. An easy walk from the Train Station. Clean rooms, although small (i.e. European standards). Free internet access in the lounge. Very nice breakfast spread. Very helpful staff. Great rates as well. Would definitely stay again.
Reviews.Author: pcourt

Reviews.Content: Perfectly satisfactory, no problems Just returned from a 4-night stay at the Victoria in Frankfurt. The staff was attentive and friendly. My room was small but very clean, functional, and quiet. I especially appreciated how my room was ready for early check-in when I arrived after my overnight flight, and Herr Klotz even offered me late breakfast, coffee, etc. right at check in. (It's things like this that gain repeat customers.) Breakfast choices were somewhat limited but well presented and service was quite good. Granted, the hotel is in the red light district, but this presented no safety concerns at all. Very short walk to U-Bahn station, good bakery across the street. Certainly would recommend this hotel and got a good rate of $77.00 on Expedia. (Note: The Acapulco Italian restaurant a block away on Kaiserstrasse had the worst service of any place I've ever eaten in Germany. You have thousands of other choices in Frankfurt.)
Reviews.Author: hwcii

Reviews.Content: Big disappointment especially after reading other reviews! After paying 260Euro's for 1 night I was expecting a half decent room. Instead the room was the smallest I have ever stayed in, decor was 1970's, breakfast was awful (unless you love corn flakes), and the location was bang in the middle of the red light disctrict. I tried to complain but was told the manger finishes at 4pm so there was nothing to be done. Granted I did book at a very busy day in Frankfurt but what a big disappointment! Good point was that it was clean.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Basic But Very Nice I landed in Franfurt after an all night flight from Dubai. I was planning to just find a hotel once I got there. I discovered all were extremely expensive ($350/nite) if you didn't have a reservation. A hotel reservation service at the Frankfurt airport booked the Victoria for me which reduced the price to $125/nite. The hotel was nice, not super elegant but in a part of town while being close to the red light district was historic. Nice restaurants 1 block away. Train station 5 minute walk. Hotel staff were very helpful.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Modest Hotel, good for a quick stay The Hotel is located at the edge of the red light district, but just 3 blocks from the main train station. Because the staff seems a bit distracted, I wonder how good the security is, considering the location. Room was basic, but the breakfast was fine.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Convinient and Clean This hotel is walking distance from all major attractions and a 5 minute walk from the train station. The room was very clean and quiet. The buffet breakfast was very good. The neighborhood was not that great.
Reviews.Author: mvruiz

Reviews.Content: Thank you Manfred Klotz We absolutely loved this hotel. The staff could not have been nicer or more attentive . The manager Manfred Klotz always answered every one of my emails and we were even upgraded to a junior suite when we arrived at 7am and went to take a nap in our room. Our room was clean and very large, the bed was comfrotable and I loved my featherbed. Buffet breakfast which was included was very good. We got a free newspaper every day and free internet access. All this for only 85euros a night. A short three blocks from the bahnhof, we walked everywere. I would stay here again in a minute. Thanks again Mr Klotz.
Reviews.Author: Zabelle

Reviews.Content: 4 estrellas venido a menos       fachada
Reviews.Author: GETAFE

Reviews.Content: Nicht au脽ergew枚hnlich, aber passabel   showReview(21102320, 'full');
